Explanation.name: level of detail
Explanation.description:
If a model is further away than the LOD reduction distance, it will be reduced to that LOD. So the L1 reduction distance should be really long and the L5 reduction distance should be really short. This means distances should be in descending order, e.g. 5 4 3 2 1.
Note that if we run out of memory or too many models are on screen at once, the engine may reduce models to a lower LOD BEFORE they reach the reduction distance for that LOD.
If a model has a max draw distance, it will disappear when it reaches that distance. The max draw distance should be greater than all of the LOD reduction distances.

Enum.name: fade at super high detail level
fade at super low detail level

StringId.name: region name
StringId.units: must match region name in render_model

TagReference.name: looping effect
TagReference.description: played while the model is in this state

ShortEnum.name: sort order
ShortEnum.description: negative values mean closer to the camera

Bit.name: parent never takes body damage for us
parent never takes shield damage for us

Real.name: body system shock
Real.description: anything that kills us (body depleted) doing more than this amount of damage also destroys us

RealFraction.name: friendly damage resistance
RealFraction.description: the fraction of damage caused by friendly units ignored by this object (zero means full damage)

Real.name: body damaged threshold
Real.description: when passing this vitality the 'body damaged' effect, below, is created

Real.name: body destroyed threshold
Real.description: when passing this vitality (usually negative) the object is deleted

Real.name: maximum shield vitality
Real.description: the default initial and maximum shield vitality of this object

Real.name: minimum stun damage
Real.description: the minimum damage required to stun this object's shields

Real.name: stun time
Real.description: the length of time the shields stay stunned (do not recharge) after taking damage

Real.name: recharge time
Real.description: the length of time it would take for the shields to fully recharge after being completely depleted

Explanation.name: damage section flags
Explanation.description: * absorbs body damage: damage to this section does not count against body vitality * headshottable: takes extra headshot damage when shot * ignores shields: damage to this section bypasses shields

Bit.name: takes full dmg when object dies
takes full dmg when obj dstryd

Explanation.name: Constraint damage type
Explanation.description: * if you specify a constraint group name (see lower section of this block) you can specify a constraint damage * loosening a constraint takes it out of the rigid state - activates it * destroying a constraint sets the attached body free

Explanation.name: Damage response flags
Explanation.description: * kills object: when the response fires the object dies regardless of its current health * inhibits <x>: from halo 1 - disallows basic behaviors for a unit * forces drop weapon: from halo 1 - makes the unit drop its current weapon * kills weapon <x> trigger: destroys the <x> trigger on the unit's current weapon * destroys object: when the response fires the object is destroyed

Real.name: damage threshold
Real.description: repsonse fires after crossing this threshold. 1=full health

Explanation.name: Response delay
Explanation.description: If desired, you can specify a delay until the response fires.This delay is pre-empted if another timed response for the same section fires.The delay effect plays while the timer is counting down

Explanation.name: Constraint destruction
Explanation.description: - a response can destroy a single constraint by naming it explicitly. - alternatively it can randomly destroy a single constraint from a specified group if the "destroy one group constraint" flag is set - also it can destroy all constraints in a specified group if the "destroy all group constraints" flag is set

Explanation.name: destroyed child object marker name
Explanation.description: when this response fires, any children objects created at the supplied marker name will be destroyed

Explanation.name: total damage threshold
Explanation.description: scale on total damage section vitality

Real.name: minimum stun damage
Real.description: the minimum damage required to stun this object's health

Real.name: stun time
Real.description: the length of time the health stay stunned (do not recharge) after taking damage

Real.name: recharge time
Real.description: the length of time it would take for the shields to fully recharge after being completely depleted

RealFraction.name: recharge fraction
RealFraction.description: 0 defaults to 1 - to what maximum level the body health will be allowed to recharge

Real.name: maximum shield vitality
Real.description: the default initial and maximum shield vitality of this object

Real.name: minimum stun damage
Real.description: the minimum damage required to stun this object's shields

Real.name: stun time
Real.description: the length of time the shields stay stunned (do not recharge) after taking damage

Real.name: recharge time
Real.description: the length of time it would take for the shields to fully recharge after being completely depleted

Explanation.name: level of detail
Explanation.description:
If a model is further away than the LOD reduction distance, it will be reduced to that LOD. So the L1 reduction distance should be really long and the L5 reduction distance should be really short. This means distances should be in descending order, e.g. 5 4 3 2 1.
Note that if we run out of memory or too many models are on screen at once, the engine may reduce models to a lower LOD BEFORE they reach the reduction distance for that LOD.
If a model has a begin fade distance and disappear distance, it will begin fading out at that distance, reaching zero alpha and disappearing at the disappear distance. These distances should be greater than all of the LOD reduction distances.

StringId.name: marker name
StringId.description: multiple markers become multiple spheres of the same radius

Angle.name: cone angle
Angle.description: the target is only visible when viewed within this angle of the marker's x axis

CustomShortBlockIndex.name: damage section
CustomShortBlockIndex.description: the target is associated with this damage section

ShortBlockIndex.name: variant
ShortBlockIndex.description: the target will only appear with this variant

RealFraction.name: targeting relevance
RealFraction.description: higher relevances turn into stronger magnetisms

TagReference.name: default dialogue
TagReference.description: The default dialogue tag for this model (overriden by variants)

StringId.name: default dialogue effect
StringId.description: The default dialogue tag for this model (overriden by variants)

Explanation.name: SCENARIO LOAD PARAMETERS
Explanation.description: strip-variant <variant-name> strips a given variant out of the model tag strip-dialogue strips all the dialogue for this model i.e. cinematic only

Explanation.name: HOLOGRAM
Explanation.description: hologram shader is applied whenever the control function from it's object is non-zero
